ld.name: CRUMBLE
ld.body:
# Welcome to CRUMBLE!

![thumbnail.png](///raw/093/21/z/19395.png)


## The islands around you are all CRUMBLING, but they have valuable resources!



## Collect as many as you can before the island CRUMBLES!



### Blue tiles have resources.



### Gray tiles are about to CRUMBLE.



You can repair a gray tile by spending 5000 points while standing on it. Then press [R].



If you get stuck with no way of escape, you can hit [X] and for 10000 points, teleport!

Use the arrow keys to choose where to teleport to, and hit [ENTER] when you are ready!


## Remember: There are hidden gems around the islands. Find all 6 parts and you can escape that island and move onto the next!

COMMENT YOUR HIGHSCORE FOR A CHANCE TO GET FEATURED ON THIS GAME PAGE

CURRENT RECORD HOLDER:

@Connell - 210,300 POINTS

![img0.png](///raw/093/21/z/18a1e.png)

![img1.png](///raw/093/21/z/18a20.png)

![img2.png](///raw/093/21/z/18a23.png)

![img3.png](///raw/093/21/z/18a25.png)


Everyone on our team is an adolescent!

**Also, just to make this clear, a lot of people don’t like movement. Well CRUMBLE is a turn based game so you should be thinking about your next move after you move. Stuff only happens when you move!**

ld.name: Castle Crabers
ld.body:
![TITRE_castle_crabers3.png](///raw/075/2/z/1829a.png)

# Scenario

August 13th, 2018. One of the rarest event on our planet is about to begin: Fertility Day. Once a year, Seafront ocypodes rush out of the shallow water of Helodrano Bay and look for a partner in an unusual courtship ritual. Males must build a powerful sandcastle in a race against the rising tide to have a chance to be selected by a female!
It is the very first Fertility Day for Eustache, and failure is not an option. Fertility Day only happens once a year, it is his only chance to impress Hexa and he will not miss it. Grab your mouse and your keyboard, it is time to help a crab in love and build faster than the incoming sea!  
  
Curious about Fertility Day? Follow this link to have a better understanding of Eustache’s past and the life full of danger of Seafront ocypodes.    

Documentary link : https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KIaxVpq_wAgbOQ7FaPYcEZYf9RRHKn3YV0B5aUrhTDI/
  
# Description
  
Your main objective is to stay alive and build the biggest castle you can.    

Right click to move your character to the mouse position.
Use your mouse wheel to select one of the three following left mouse click actions:
* Select the shovel and hold left click to shovel out a layer of sand
* Pick the bucket to replenish a tile of sand
* Use your hammer to create castle to protect yourself from the sea

![Cap1.PNG](///raw/075/2/z/184dd.png)

![Cap2.PNG](///raw/075/2/z/184e1.png)

![Cap3.PNG](///raw/075/2/z/184f2.png)
  
## Main Team :
* Grégoire “Greet” DUFLO
* Maximilien “Maximilien” PLUCHARD
* Hugo “Raiponz” BEAUCAMPS
* Olivier “Zessirb” BRISSEZ
* Pipostit
* Straken

## Support Team :
* Agloo
* Ben Backen
* Shyno

# How to play :

1. - Dig sand 
2. - Reinforce the sand
3. - Build your own castle
  
use scroll mouse to switch tools or use key 1-2-3

# Install instructions :
  
Click to itch.io link, And Play !
  
# Other informations :
  
Credit Music : Jukedeck (create your own at http://jukedeck.com/)​
  
Game created with 344 commit using Git​

ld.name: Spaced Out
ld.body:
This is the game Spaced Out. A game where you are play as the sole agent of the Jupiter Jets Real Estate Agency. Your rivals, the Saturn Sharks, are aggressively buying up all of the real estate across the universe. Beat those sharks before space runs out!

*** Navigation and shop not implemented, so enjoy chilling out and killing enemy real estate agents! You can't die =) ***

Mouse to Control Ship Direction

W - Boost

E - Brake

Q / E - Roll Left/Right

This game was made for Ludum Dare 42 Compo, but I ran out of time so it's a jam entry.  All art, music and programming were created by me.

ld.name: Black Market Nostalgia
ld.body:
You live in a city run by an evil corporation called Exaction Corp. They have it's citizens contained and controlled just they way they like it, but you can't stand it any longer. It's time to fight against the powers that be by distributing mix tapes and bootlegged VHS. Remove the evil influence of the corporation by gaining your own.

Start in your home neighborhood and distribute your nostalgic items. As you gain influence you will get the option to unlock any neighborhood you want and distribute your items (the buttons will light up). But be careful. The better a neighborhood's temperament is toward the corporation, the harder it is to earn influence. However, the neighborhoods with higher class citizens will pay more chits for your items. Spend chits at the shop to increase your voice, which will help you earn more influence.

Win by removing all corporate influence from the neighborhoods. Lose by giving up and abandoning your city.

NOTE: If your browser isn't in view, the music will continue to player, but the game itself will not. This is not intended for an idle game, but you know, I ran out of time.

EDIT: Fixed a game breaking bug that slowed the gain of influence then crashed the game. The game runs a little too fast now and the numbers can get out of control, but at least it's playable. Thank you for playing.

ld.body:
![ld42_20.gif](///raw/3fe/11/z/15d76.gif)

Gather resources, build things. 
The more you mine, the less space you have...
Also, beware, the ground is unstable!

**Controls**: Left click: okay, Right click: Cancel.

Build while you can!

Very nice execution of the theme. Besides what @metalsnail said (because half of the video is just waiting for the final screen), I would consider adding something like information how many points the 'building' gives.

This is really well done! An option to skip turns would be nice, (Especially once you've built on every available square) but this is not really a knock against the quality of the game.

jiananshi9 hours ago

Gr8 game reminds me of "Angry bird" once I found out how to interact with it, well I'm going to talk more about "interact", which also known as "UX", objects that could be interacted with should have significant tip like big word, bright colors(difference with background) or animate tip, it did takes a while before I found out I can drag and drop with the rabbit. Besides, the physical engine and UI was excellent, also the object sounds, developers did take their time working on this and it is a game worth trying, if compares with last game this developer cr8ed it's a big step forward, good luck!

ld.name: Space Adyssey
ld.body:
![Screen Shot 2018-08-14 at 10.06.07.png](///raw/60f/71/z/18f7a.png)

A quest through space, without adblock enabled.

Keep you ship alive by taping the flashing lights on your ship's dashboard and avoiding space trash.
Don't run out of screen space... or space in general.

Done in 48h on Ljubljana Ludum Dare Game Jam.

Space Adyssey

A quest through space, without adblock enabled.

Keep you ship alive by taping the flashing lights on your ship's dashboard and avoiding space trash.
Don't run out of screen space... or space in general.

Current build is quite performance intensive... A low framerate won't allow you to play the game. Tested with a Samsung S8.

Done in 48h on Ljubljana Ludum Dare Game Jam.

CREDITS:

  • Àdam Carballo - Developer (Twitter)
  • Marko Krajinovic - Developer
  • Nik Maierle - 3D Artist (Portafolio)
  • Leja Pelc - Artist (Portafolio)
  • Teja Gerkman - Artist (Portafolio)
  • Loris Timotej Vodeb - Artist

ld.name: Virus: Rabbit
ld.body:
In Virus: Rabbit you play as a self-replicating resource consuming virus. You must travel from room to room infecting the machine and consuming resources.

Once you have defeated the security measures in the room you can move onto the next, you must move onto the next room before the current room runs out of memory space.

This game was created for the Ludum Dare 42 Jam by a small team of 4 people (and 1 dog)

# Controls

W, A, S, D or Arrow Keys - Move around 
Mouse - Aim
Left Click - Attack

![menu.PNG](///raw/30f/71/z/17dc1.png)
![play1.PNG](///raw/30f/71/z/17dc3.png)

# Team

* Rob Parker - Programming, "Art", architecting, 
* Josie Messa - Programming, bug finding, Coffee fueled screeching
* Chris Bean - Programming, Supplier of pastries, level design
* Matt Rattley - Music, Remote support, Gif finder

# Special Thanks

* Spotify - endless music
* The handful of people who joined the twitch stream
* Redbull/coffee
* Mite, the 12 year old cocker spaniel for distracting us.
* Ed Moffatt for the creating our "company" logo.

instructionsMarkdown:
In Virus: Rabbit you play as a self-replicating resource consuming virus. You must travel from room to room infecting the machine and consuming resources.

Once you have defeated the security measures in the room you can move onto the next, you must move onto the next room before the current room runs out of memory space.

This game was created for the Ludum Dare 42 Jam by a small team of 4 people (and 1 dog)

# Controls

W, A, S, D or Arrow Keys - Move around 
Mouse - Aim
Left Click - Attack

Virus: Rabbit

Support This Game

In Virus: Rabbit you play as a self-replicating resource consuming virus. You must travel from room to room infecting the machine and consuming resources.

Once you have defeated the security measures in the room you can move onto the next, you must move onto the next room before the current room runs out of memory space.

This game was created for the Ludum Dare 42 Jam by a small team of 4 people (and 1 dog). The theme for Ludum Dare 42 was "Running out of Space".
